Risk Warning

IMPORTANT: Please read this risk warning carefully before trading.

General Risk Warning

Trading foreign exchange, contracts for difference (CFDs), and other financial instruments carries a high level of risk and may not be suitable for all investors. The high degree of leverage can work against you as well as for you. Before deciding to trade, you should carefully consider your investment objectives, level of experience, and risk appetite.

You may lose some or all of your invested capital. Do not invest money you cannot afford to lose.

1. Risk of Loss

Trading financial instruments involves substantial risk of loss. You may lose all of your initial investment and may be required to pay additional funds. Losses can exceed your initial deposit. You should not trade unless you fully understand the nature of the transactions you are entering into and the extent of your exposure to loss.

2. Leverage Risk

The use of leverage magnifies both profits and losses. While leverage allows you to control larger positions with a smaller amount of capital, it also increases the risk of significant losses. A small adverse market movement can result in substantial losses that exceed your initial investment.

Example: With 1:100 leverage, a 1% adverse price movement can result in a 100% loss of your margin.

3. Market Risk

Financial markets are volatile and unpredictable. Prices can move rapidly and significantly due to:

  • Economic news and data releases
  • Central bank decisions
  • Geopolitical events
  • Market sentiment
  • Technical factors
  • Unexpected events

These movements can result in substantial losses, even when using risk management tools.

4. Liquidity Risk

Some financial instruments may have limited liquidity, particularly during volatile market conditions or outside normal trading hours. This can result in:

  • Wider spreads
  • Difficulty closing positions
  • Slippage (execution at worse prices)
  • Gaps in prices

5. Counterparty Risk

When trading with us, you are exposed to counterparty risk. This means you are relying on our ability to meet our obligations. While we take measures to manage this risk, you should be aware that in extreme circumstances, there is a risk that we may not be able to meet our obligations.

6. Technology Risk

Trading platforms and systems are subject to:

  • Technical failures
  • Internet connectivity issues
  • System downtime
  • Cyber attacks
  • Data loss

These issues may prevent you from:

  • Opening or closing positions
  • Accessing your account
  • Receiving real-time prices
  • Executing trades at desired prices

7. Regulatory Risk

Regulatory changes in your jurisdiction or ours may affect:

  • The availability of trading services
  • Leverage limits
  • Account features
  • Your ability to access funds

8. Currency Risk

If you trade in a currency different from your base currency, exchange rate fluctuations can affect:

  • The value of your account
  • Your profits and losses
  • Deposit and withdrawal amounts

9. Overnight and Weekend Risk

Holding positions overnight or over weekends exposes you to:

  • Gap risk (price jumps between sessions)
  • Swap fees (overnight financing costs)
  • Increased volatility when markets reopen
  • Limited ability to manage positions

10. Psychological Risk

Trading can be emotionally challenging. Common psychological risks include:

  • Overtrading
  • Revenge trading
  • Fear of missing out (FOMO)
  • Holding losing positions too long
  • Closing winning positions too early
  • Ignoring your trading plan

Emotional decisions often lead to losses. Maintain discipline and stick to your trading plan.

11. Information Risk

Relying on:

  • Market analysis
  • Trading signals
  • Educational materials
  • Third-party advice

Does not guarantee profits. Past performance does not indicate future results. Always conduct your own research and analysis.

12. Tax Implications

Trading profits may be subject to taxation in your jurisdiction. Tax laws vary by country and can change. You are responsible for:

  • Understanding tax obligations
  • Reporting trading income
  • Paying applicable taxes
  • Seeking professional tax advice

13. No Guarantee of Profit

There is no guarantee that you will make profits from trading. Many traders lose money. Success requires:

  • Extensive knowledge and experience
  • Proper risk management
  • Emotional discipline
  • Sufficient capital
  • Time and dedication

14. Recommendations

Before trading, you should:

  1. Educate Yourself: Learn about trading, markets, and risk management
  2. Start Small: Begin with small amounts you can afford to lose
  3. Use Demo Accounts: Practice with virtual funds before trading with real money
  4. Set Limits: Use stop-loss orders and position sizing
  5. Seek Advice: Consult with independent financial advisors
  6. Understand Products: Fully understand the instruments you trade
  7. Monitor Positions: Regularly review and manage your trades
  8. Stay Informed: Keep up with market news and events

15. Suitability

Trading may not be suitable for you if:

  • You cannot afford to lose your investment
  • You do not understand the risks
  • You have limited trading experience
  • You are not comfortable with high-risk investments
  • You rely on trading income for essential expenses

16. Acknowledgment

By trading with us, you acknowledge that:

  • You have read and understood this risk warning
  • You understand the risks involved
  • You are aware that you may lose your investment
  • You are trading at your own risk
  • You have the financial capacity to bear losses
  • You have received independent advice if needed

17. Seek Professional Advice

If you are unsure whether trading is suitable for you, or if you have any questions about the risks, you should:

  • Consult with a qualified financial advisor
  • Seek legal advice
  • Contact our support team
  • Review educational materials
